name: Holiday Inn London - Heathrow

reviews.text: Did an overnight stay, had a standard room which was spacious and clean. Bathroom was clean and in great shape. Beds were cozy and the pillows were perfect. Check-in was fast and the front desk was professional and courteous. Used the Hotel Hoppa to get to the airport from the hotel, jumped on the bus just outside the hotel entrance.
reviews.title: Nice and Convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife & I have stayed here now four times & use this as a 'base' hotel before flying away on our holidays & use on our return. It's ideally situated to just rest up & get a good nights sleep here before we 'jet' off & even better for when we return from a long haul flight to just 'hit the sack', instead of a long ride home. We always stay B&B as evening meals are a bit expensive - use the Three Magpies Pub up the road for evening meals, cheap & cheerful & Sky Sports so all good - otherwise Holiday Inn very good, breakfasts here excellent, eggs, omelettes cooked to order which makes a change to the norm. Go for their loyalty card, Priority Club rewards - better deals & priority checking-in.
reviews.title: Ideal for prior to flying away & on return

reviews.text: There were several people waiting to be checked-in when I arrived at Holiday Inn–Heathrow but I joined the Priority Club Line and I was checked in moments later. I was recognised as a Platinum member and given an upgrade to an Executive Room with a runway view. I was also asked if I wanted a wake up call and complimentary newspaper the following morning.
reviews.title: An excellent stay

reviews.text: The room was spacious but the décor seemed unchanged since my last visit in 2009 but the room was very pleasant and the furniture and fittings were in good condition. In the room there was flat screen interactive TV, hairdryer, Tea/Coffee facilities with biscuits, sitting area with armchair and stool, complimentary magazines, sparkling and still water and chocolate bar.
reviews.title: Great overnight stay for early morning flight!

reviews.text: In the wardrobe there was a trouser press, iron and ironing board and plenty of coat hangers. The double bed was extremely comfortable and there was plenty of storage space. The bathroom was of reasonable size with bath-tub, powerful shower, plenty of upgraded toiletries and weighing scales.
reviews.title: All good here....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got in to Heathrow airport too late to want to first pick up a "hire car" and do even the short drive into London to our destination, so we reserved a room at this property using Priority Club points; this location seemed the most reasonable in terms of what a given number of points would "buy. We were not displeased, although we thought the rack rates and restaurant prices were high, though there are possibilities of discounts a/o "rewards" stays. The price is a bit less unreasonable in that this is a full-service hotel with a proper dining room serving breakfast, lunch and dinner and bar and in that the staff did such a good job.
reviews.title: A Good Possibility for an Overnight near the Airport

reviews.text: The room was attractive and spotlessly clean. Linens were a good quality, "firm" and "soft" pillows were supplied, and the bedding was very comfortable. The bathroom was modern and practical with enough good towels and water pressure.
reviews.title: Standard Holiday Inn business hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had requested "high floor" and "quiet room" and our room (1211) on the 2nd floor (third in U.S. terminology) was in a very quiet wing. We were pleased that windows opened enough for good ventilation and overnight the airport and the road nearby became quiet enough that we were happy sleeping with the window open. Our room was a reasonable size for a double with sofa; the bathroom was also a reasonable size and had a tub with shower over it. Our only criticism of the room was that there was only one (large) drawer; all other storage was open. This works fine for an overnight stay, but would be less so in our opinion for a longer stay.
reviews.title: Transit Hotel

reviews.text: We'd had a meal on the plane about 1 1/2 hours before landing but wanted something light before bed. The restaurant was open and we had good sandwiches which were served with corn chips and a very nice salad on the side, but they were not cheap; not outrageous for a hotel coffee shop or dining room, but not cheap. For those hungrier, there was a buffet dinner at 20 BPS which, while also not cheap, seemed a reasonable deal; had we not wanted to eat lightly before retiring, we would have had the buffet. The dining room closed at 10:30 PM; the bar stayed open later, and some food was also available there.
reviews.title: Excellent Airport Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast the next morning was, to our minds, expensive, at BPS14 for the "continental" breakfast buffet, but it had a good selection and we were pleased with it. For one pound more, if booked with the room on check-in, (but more if not booked the night before,) the "Full British" breakfast included the Continental buffet as well at the usual cholest-fest of a traditional breakfast. If pre-booked we thought it a good value. Priority Club members also get a card granting a 10% discount for food and beverages in the dining room and, I think, the bar.
reviews.title: Convenient, clean and quiet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A slightly strange hotel with reception that is off the main road. We had a good experience at reception and were given a 10% off every thing we bought card. I bought a couple of drinks forgetting I had my card. I then remembered but was told it was too late, they'd rung it up. I made a remark that they'd soon sort it if they'd made a mistake. However a short while later they resolved the situation by giving me my discount so fair dos. It would be much better if they just dropped the price by 10%! The price of sandwiches, like most hotels was over priced and the choice of beers limited. However we got what we paid for and I would use this hotel again. We had a very good breakfast
reviews.title: Good experience

reviews.text: A short journey by bus to the airport terminals. Limited parking available on site for £12 per night.
reviews.title: Convenient for airport - no early breakfast available.

reviews.text: Reminded more of their 'Express' brand but perfectly adequate for one night. Breakfast (including room service) doesn't start until 6am which is too late if you have an early check-in. if they could provide a buffet breakfast from 4.30am say, this would be a great benefit to traveling customers.
reviews.title: Nice enough, comfy enough but not the best of Holiday Inn Restaurant/Bar services

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No problems we the room. Food in the bar was poor and this was the first time I have ever had a bad pint of Beck IV -- presumably the lines needed cleaning.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.text: Check out was slow as the discount I had negociated on parking hadn't been passed on - thank goodness it wasn't busy at that time of the morning,
reviews.title: A Quiet Spot In A Busy Area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here before our trip to Thailand. The hotel itself is very nice and we had a very nice meal and some drinks in the bar area which we really enjoyed. The room was clean, with good facilities and we were very happy with it. We were very disappointed however when we did not receive a wake up call, as requested the night before. We had an early flight. The rooms do not offer alarm clocks which is very strange considering it is an airport hotel but I did not think much of it as I put my trust in the staff and was extremely unhappy that they did not provide the wake up call. I will be staying at a hotel near Heathrow again before my next flight and was planning to stay here but now I am not so sure. Such a shame for that to let it down.
reviews.title: Excellent until departure

reviews.text: I have stayed here a few times on business. The hotel is a great example of bad hotel architecture, but don't let it put you off. The service has always been very good at reception, room service and at breakfast. Although the food is pricey (but not any different to other similar hotels), the food is a bit better than average. Room noise insulation is good despite being near one of the runways. The basement car park doesn't allow a lot of room between cars and instead of using the hotel hoppa use the regular bus service that depart from outside the hotel. More frequent and cheaper to all the terminals. Use Google maps to look at live departure times from the bus stops nearby. The rooms are fine but looking a bit dated compared to some now.
reviews.title: Decent Holiday Inn, shame about the architecture!

reviews.text: I have been staying in this Hotel since 2007 And have been a regular since then!!
reviews.title: A true value for money hotel and better than downtown hotels!

reviews.text: Prior to staying at Holiday Inn, Sipson Way, have stayed in many zone 1 hotels and then while on an overnight stay before catching a flight to US, I stayed at this Hotel. It was an amazing experience and I realized that the Airport Hotels are much better than Central London hotels.
reviews.title: VERY HANDY FOR THE AIRPORT

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are clean & spacious, there is no noise from the outside, the runway views are excellent, they have a nice bar and attached restaurant and its so easy to get to the Airport, tube or the Heathrow express train. The beds are not creaking and are cozy, the pillow menu exists and the bathrooms maintained.
reviews.title: Reasonable overnight stop

aka: Holiday Inn London - Heathrow Hotel West Drayton
description: Enjoy Holiday Inn London - Heathrow hotel for all the convenience of the airport with excellent transport links to central London. We are just 5 minutes from Heathrow Airport by Hoppa bus or taxi so staying with us is a great way to relax in a fresh and modern hotel. With our triple-glazed windows, flat screen TVs, air conditioning and high-speed wireless internet (free for the 1st half an hour of usage) in every non smoking guest guest room we aim to make your stay as productive and refreshing as you require.
